clues.clue: Receiving these gems from Central African dictator Jean-Bédel Bokassa helped end the presidency of France's Valery Giscard d'Estaing
A conservative MP & commentator on this network, Bob Boothby endured the revelations of his association with gangster Ronnie Kray
You & I pay fees for this, withdrawing money we don't have; in a '90s scandal 300 congressmen did it with the House bank no problem
This Italian P.M. said there was no scandal in 2009 after photos surfaced of scantily clad women at his villa
As attorney general under U.S. Grant, Edwards Pierrepont spent lots of time prosecuting this "Ring" of distillers who bribed & frauded
The 2023 Grammys were good to aging redheads: Bonnie Raitt got Song of the Year & he took Best Country Solo Performance
She earned our respect by singing "Respect" during her "American Idol" days before having her own hit with "Behind These Hazel Eyes"
This lead singer of Hole said, "I tried out for 'the Mickey Mouse Club' when I was 11", & that would've been very interesting casting
CBGB was a legendary East Village club where many punk & new wave acts got an early break, including them
Unafraid of long album titles like "When the Pawn..." (it does go on), she shortened things up in 2020 with "Fetch the Bolt Cutters"
At nearly 3 pounds a year per capita, salmon has passed this as the most commonly consumed fish in the U.S.; sorry, Charlie
Succulent but potentially lethal, Japan's specially prepared delicacy known as fugu uses a variety of this type of fish
In 1997 this U.S. state designated the Bonneville cutthroat trout as its official state fish
This fish of the order Clupeiformes is kippered or cured by splitting, cleaning, salting & smoking
Fish found in this African lake created in the 1960s include 2 species of tilapia & the enormous Nile perch

"Therefore the Lord God sent" him "forth from the Garden of Eden, to till the ground"

Truman: "I didn't fire" him "because he was a dumb son of a (bleep), although he was, but that's not against the law for generals"
In Greek myth, after he was born lame, his mom yeeted him out of heaven, but he returned & made Hermes' winged helmet
This bear who first appeared in a 1958 book was part of many people's tributes to the late Queen Elizabeth II

This nickname for many kings follows "M.C. Higgins" in the title of the first Newbery Medal winner by a Black author

AUU

OOOO

OUEE

A secret reason for doing something is having a this "motive":
UEIO
You're in charge if you do something "like a" this, meaning to do it with style & swagger
It's a vibratory sound, or the excitement generated by a cool new product or performer
There are 2 Bs in the name of this jazz style pioneered by Charlie Parker & other hepcats
In 1958 the San Francisco Examiner worried that "growing lads" might become these "instead of ball players"
This last name of an uber-cool Hollywood icon is also a verb meaning to hog something, which is way not cool
Vaka moana are traditional double-hulled these boats used to travel vast ocean distances
Including Palmerston & Pukapuka, this vast expanse of islands was named after a British captain who visited in 1773
Including the Loyalty Islands, the island group known as "New" this basically means "New Scotland"
This double-talk island of the Society Islands is surrounded by coral reefs
Although this country has more than 300 islands, about 70% of the population lives on its largest, Viti Levu

"Socialism of any type & shade leads to a total destruction of the human spirit"

An artist: 
"Why must art be static?... the next step in sculpture is motion"
Always armed with the catchphrase no one in the "Star Trek" world wanted to hear, the Borg let it be known that this "is futile"
Jacques Cartier was among the explorers who failed to find this fabled route illustrated here
In the "Odyssey", Homer wrote this man was "in violent torment, seeking to raise a monstrous stone" but ever failing
The scene of heavy fighting & futility in World War I, this peninsula bears a name that comes from the Greek for "beautiful city"
Harry Potter might have a better chance of turning metals to gold using this medieval substance from alchemy, also called the tincture
Before Elena Kagan was the first woman to be dean of this at Harvard, she was the first bat mitzvah at Lincoln Square Synagogue

First name of the philanthropist who has gone by the last names Tuttle, Bezos & now Scott
